title: How to Make a Ribbon Journal

steps.title: Take a good amount of paper (20-30 pages, or more, depends how thick you want your journal to be) and cut them in half.
steps.content: Take a good amount of paper (20-30 pages, or more, depends how thick you want your journal to be) and cut them in half. Hole punch the left side of the paper (where you want your journal to be bound.) There should be three to five holes, more if you want the binding to hold together better, though the more holes you have, the more ribbon you’ll need.

steps.title: Find something to use as a cover.
steps.content: Find something to use as a cover. Some thick construction or scrapbooking paper should work.

steps.title: Decorate your cover.
steps.content: Decorate your cover. You could paint a picture , trace your hand, paste stickers or photos on it, make doodles, write a poem, or anything you feel like. Be creative! (Or you could use paper that already has a design.)

steps.title: Cut a strip of ribbon that is long enough to hold all the paper together.
steps.content: Cut a strip of ribbon that is long enough to hold all the paper together. If you’d like, you can use several different ribbons to make it more colorful.

steps.title: Thread the strips of ribbon though the holes punched in the paper.
steps.content: Thread the strips of ribbon though the holes punched in the paper. This is the most important step because how well you secure the ribbon depends on if your journal will fall apart or not. Make sure the paper is secure in the ribbons.

steps.title: Tie it off with a flourish, and now you have your own personal journal.
steps.content: Tie it off with a flourish, and now you have your own personal journal. You can write or doodle in it, do whatever you want!
